paragraphs: The Most Excellent Lords, Heads of the Exalted Council of X, having been informed by the Lords Reformers of the University of Padua, through the report of the two appointed to this task, namely the Reverend Father Inquisitor, and the Secretary of the Senate, Gio: Maraueglia, under oath, that in the book titled De Phoenomenis in Orbe Lunae, there is nothing against the laws, and it is worthy of printing; they grant permission for it to be printed in this city.
Secretary of the Most Illustrious Council of X, Barthol. Cominus.
1611, on the 12th of November. Registered in the book at page 92.
Ioan. Baptista Breatto, Office against Blasphemy.

Most candid reader, you may perhaps be indignant, when in this golden booklet you notice some errors from the printing press, such as on the first page, "perspecta" for "perfecta", "extra his" for "ex his", and others; in orthography likewise, such as "caducaeum" for "Caducaeum", and others, even a lack of commas and periods.
Excuse the first impression, attacked by so many obstacles; and await the second, complete in all respects and most correct.
